GapFillInput.Title: Present perfect continuous and Present perfect simple
GapFillInput.Instruction: Write the full sentence using the Present perfect simple or the Present perfect continuous and the words in brackets ( ). Type your answers in the gaps, using short forms if necessary.

Content.Question:
1. We've been waiting for an hour.|We've waited for an hour. (We / wait / an hour.)
2. How long have you had your computer? (How long / you / have / your computer?)
3. My mother's been living here since December.|My mother's lived here since December. (My mother / live / here / December.)
4. Have you been studying Russian for a long time?|Have you studied Russian for a long time? (you / study / Russian / long time?)
5. Tina hasn't known Mr Tracey for long.|Tina hasn't known Mr Tracey long. (Tina / not / know / Mr Tracey / long.)
6. Kerry's loved dancing all her life. (Kerry / love / dance / all / life.)
7. Pete's been sleeping since 8 o'clock.|Pete's slept since 8 o'clock. (Pete / sleep / 8 o'clock.)
8. How long have your parents been married? (How long / your parents / be / married?)
9. I haven't been feeling well all day.|I haven't felt well all day. (I / not / feel / well / all day.)
10. How long has Carla owned her apartment? (How long / Carla / own / her apartment?)
